intro: Oxydectes eluteria, commonly known as the flame violet, is a striking flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Violaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that range in color from deep red to purple. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, velvety texture, adding to its ornamental appeal. Oxydectes eluteria thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full shade, making it a popular choice for shaded garden beds.
